Literature Review: Virus-derived small RNAs and microRNAs play a crucial role in the interaction between viruses and their hosts, influencing various aspects of health and disease. The discovery of virus-encoded microRNAs (v-miRNAs) has expanded our understanding of the complex mechanisms underlying viral infections. These small noncoding RNAs can regulate all steps of gene expression, including induction, transcription, and translation, thereby contributing to the evasion of the host's immune system and the maintenance of chronic latent infection.
